hf.name: Dr. Hartley
hf.appearance: Tall, with piercing blue eyes and graying hair

json_to_edit.voice_over: In the depths of my stolen existence, I finally faced the truth of my creation.
json_to_edit.description: Alex, the doppelgänger, confronts Dr. Hartley in his secret laboratory.
json_to_edit.name: Confrontation of Creation
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Alex, a doppelgänger who has been living someone else's life, confronts his creator, Dr. Hartley, in a tense and revelatory encounter.

qa.action: Alex bursts into the laboratory, startling Dr. Hartley who is working at his computer.

hf.action: Dr. Hartley rises from his chair, a mix of surprise and intrigue on his face as he faces Alex.

tr.action: Alex's face, a mirror image of Dr. Hartley's, contorts with confusion and anger.

xc.action: From Alex's perspective, we see Dr. Hartley frantically trying to hide documents on his desk.

ka.action: Alex and Dr. Hartley stand face to face, their identical features highlighting the surreal nature of their confrontation.

fn.action: Dr. Hartley's eyes widen as he realizes the full extent of his creation's awareness.

af.action: Alex lunges forward, grabbing Dr. Hartley by the lapels of his lab coat.

qo.action: The identical eyes of creator and creation lock in a moment of shared realization and fear.

edit_command: Add a new shot before each existing shot, but don't change anything else in the scene.

updated_json.voice_over: In the depths of my stolen existence, I finally faced the truth of my creation.
updated_json.description: Alex, the doppelgänger, confronts Dr. Hartley in his secret laboratory.
updated_json.name: Confrontation of Creation
updated_json.scene_summary: Alex, a doppelgänger who has been living someone else's life, confronts his creator, Dr. Hartley, in a tense and revelatory encounter.

zt.action: The camera pans across the dimly lit corridor leading to Dr. Hartley's secret laboratory.

qa.action: Alex bursts into the laboratory, startling Dr. Hartley who is working at his computer.

yx.action: From Alex's perspective, we see the lab for the first time, focusing on Dr. Hartley's shocked expression.

hf.action: Dr. Hartley rises from his chair, a mix of surprise and intrigue on his face as he faces Alex.

lm.action: Close-up of Alex's hand clenching into a fist, revealing his growing tension.

tr.action: Alex's face, a mirror image of Dr. Hartley's, contorts with confusion and anger.

nv.action: The camera follows Dr. Hartley as he moves towards his desk, trying to maintain composure.

xc.action: From Alex's perspective, we see Dr. Hartley frantically trying to hide documents on his desk.

pb.action: The lab appears off-kilter as Alex and Dr. Hartley circle each other, emphasizing the unbalanced situation.

ka.action: Alex and Dr. Hartley stand face to face, their identical features highlighting the surreal nature of their confrontation.

wd.action: Dr. Hartley's face shows a mix of pride and fear as he fully comprehends his creation standing before him.

fn.action: Dr. Hartley's eyes widen as he realizes the full extent of his creation's awareness.

ek.action: The background warps as we zoom in on Alex, highlighting his growing anger and determination.

af.action: Alex lunges forward, grabbing Dr. Hartley by the lapels of his lab coat.

rj.action: Close-up of Alex's hands gripping Dr. Hartley's lab coat, knuckles white with tension.

qo.action: The identical eyes of creator and creation lock in a moment of shared realization and fear.

label.rationale: we will add a new shot before each existing shot in the scene, effectively doubling the number of shots from 8 to 16. this will provide more detail and pacing to the confrontation between alex and dr. hartley. we'll create new shots that complement and build up to the existing ones, enhancing the tension and visual storytelling of the scene. the new shots will be added with random two-letter keys, and the list_display_order will be updated accordingly. we'll maintain the existing shot content and order while inserting the new shots before each original one.
